source_sentence: 佛說無能勝大明王陀羅尼經
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Unsurpassed Great King of Illumination Spoken by the Buddha

source_sentence: 西天中印度摩伽陀國那爛陀寺
translation: Nālandā Temple, Magadha, Central India, Western Heaven

source_sentence: 三藏傳教大師賜紫沙門臣法天
translation: Tripiṭaka Missionary Master Granted to the Purple Monk Minister Dharma Heaven
translation of the imperial edict
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Śāriputra Ānanda and the others.
He told Śāriputra Ānanda and the others.

source_sentence: 我今宣說無能勝大明王陀羅尼。
translation: "Now, I'm going to preach the unsurpassed great luminous dhāraṇī of the king.
It's for the benefit and joy of those humans and gods.
Suppose there's a Vaiḍūṇa or a Bhūtā and so forth.

source_sentence: 於此大明王起根本業作諸障難。
translation: At this great luminous king, they'll create fundamental karma and create obstacles.
Even Yakṣa Rāṣasā.

source_sentence: 起暴惡業欲破此明王者無能破壞。
translation: They want to destroy this luminous king, but they can't do so.
He then says this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)賀娑儞(引二)尾賀娑儞(引三)護魯祖魯魯(四)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)若有聰慧之人。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他(引一)哈娑沛(引二)尾賀娑沛(引三)護鲁祖鲁鲁(四)娑婆(二合引)哈(引五)If there's a wise person, his mind isn't doubtful about this luminous king.

source_sentence: 於此明王心不疑慮尊重受持者。
translation: He respects and upholds this luminous king without doubting it in his mind.

source_sentence: 彼人於囉惹門或在師子中。
translation: That person is at the rāja gate or in the lion's midst.
When he's on the road, he's not on the road.
He's always mindful of it.

source_sentence: 乃至魔王處及遇彼冤家。
translation: It goes as far as the demon king's place and meeting his enemy.

source_sentence: 以此明王常自擁護無諸恐怖。
translation: Because this luminous king always protects himself, he has no fear.
He then says this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)度弭(引二)度度弭(引三)度麼(引)嚩諦(四)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)若有女人。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他(引一)杜弭(引二)杜多弭(引三)杜麼(引三)杜婆諦(四)娑婆 (二合引)賀(引五)If there's a woman, concentrate on and uphold it.
She focuses her attention on it and memorizes it.
She can also write it down and carry it on her head.
That person's possessions will always be abundant, and nothing will be wasted.
They'll always have plenty, and nothing will be lost.
All of his retinue will attain well-being.
He then says the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)惹嚩惹嚩(二)惹嚩儞(引三)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引四)若有女人身懷其孕。
translation: "Tānino (verse) (1) Jātri (verse) (2) Jātri (verse) (3) Sāta (verse) (4) If a woman is pregnant, she'll experience suffering and distress for a long time.
She won't be born for a long time and will experience suffering and distress.
By upholding this teaching, she'll be able to give birth easily.
He then says this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)迦捨迦捨(二)尾迦捨(三)摩賀(引)迦捨(四)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)若或有人於軍陣中互相殺時。
translation: "Tānino (verse) (1) Kāśyapa (2) Vikāśyapa (3) Mahā (verse) Kāśyapa (4) Śākya (verse) (5) If there are people who kill each other in battle, there's nothing they can do to defend them.

source_sentence: 此無能勝而為擁護咸得安住。
translation: There's nothing they can do to win and they're protected and made to stay put.
He then says this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)吒吒跓(摘故反二)致跓(准上切三)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引四)若或有人於迷醉時。
translation: "If someone is drunk, or while asleep or asleep in a dream, or even while walking or standing, this spell will help them attain stability.

source_sentence: 或睡夢中乃至行住之時。
translation: When they're asleep or asleep in a dream, or even when they're walking or standing, the multitude of people walking can't disturb them.

source_sentence: 彼步多眾無能嬈亂恒得安樂。
translation: Their steps are numerous, and they can't be disturbed or kept in constant comfort.

source_sentence: 又復有人以慇重心恒常受持諷誦宣說此無能勝。
translation: Another person always accepts, recites, chants, and preaches this unsurpassed teaching with an attitude of respect.
He embraces it during the day and night.
He listens with one mind and hears it.
He then says the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)賀囉(二)賀囉囉(三)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引四)我今宣說彼惡魔羅恃其力勢。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他(引一)贺囉(二)贺囉(三)Śaṇḍa (二合引)贺(引四)Now, I'll preach this incantation to you: 'That evil Māra relies on his strength to show up in various forms and support you.'
He shows up in various forms and characteristics and assists them.
After he saw that, the bodhisattva stopped his army.
He spoke with his brothers and said.
"For a thousand kalpas, I've sought enlightenment.
I've sacrificed my life and my men and women.
I didn't even hold back my wealth and possessions.

source_sentence: 發大誓願修此精進難行苦行。
translation: I made a great vow to cultivate this kind of effort, difficult and painful practices.
I will undertake altruistic actions for the sake of sentient beings.
With kindness and pity, he attains completion.
After he saw this, that evil Māra came to me as an obstruction.
He came and obstructed me.

source_sentence: 菩薩是時憶念此無能勝大明王陀羅尼。
translation: The bodhisattva then recalls this unsurpassed great dhāraṇī of the king of illumination.

source_sentence: 以彼明力令彼魔羅及大軍眾。
translation: With the power of that insight, he caused that māra and that great army to retreat.
They all retreated.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)伊底弭底(二)底羅弭羅(三)弭底弭隷(引)儞(四)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)於是明王現女人相。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他(引一)伊底維底(二)蒂羅威羅(三)卫底威隷(引三)訪問(四)娑婆 (二合引)贺(引五)The luminous king then manifested the form of a woman.
He came to the bodhisattva with his palms together and put his head up.
He spoke a verse, saying.

source_sentence: 大智慧宣說　　如大光普照
translation: "Great wisdom proclaims [them] like a great radiance that shines universally.

source_sentence: 而我於今日　　降伏魔羅軍
translation: On this day, I have subdued the army of Māra

source_sentence: 如汝過去求　　無上正等覺
translation: as you have sought in the past, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment

source_sentence: 乃得大無畏　　魔羅軍降伏
translation: They then attained great fearlessness, and the army of Māra was subdued.
"Now, with the power of their insight, I'll destroy Māra, that great army, and their retinue.

source_sentence: 破壞魔羅及大軍眾并諸眷屬。
translation: I'll destroy Māra, the great army, and my retinue.
He then spoke this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)迦嚩置(引二)迦嚩吒(三)謨隷(引四)曩俱羅(五)俱賀羅(六)麼(引)隷(引)儞(七)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引八)爾時世尊而說頌曰。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他 (cited) 1. Kāvaji (cited) 2. Kāvaṭa (cited) 3. Kumbhīra (cited) 4. Nāgurā (5.) Kukhīra (6.) Mā (cited) Kumbhīra (cited) Nī (7.) Saṃghā (二合引)」 (cited) 8. The Bhagavān then spoke a verse.

source_sentence: 如來正等覺　　令一切世間
translation: "The Tathāgata is perfectly enlightened and causes all the world to...

source_sentence: 得無上果者　　毒藥不能害
translation: He who has attained the unsurpassed result cannot be harmed by poisonous herbs.

source_sentence: 器杖不能傷　　火亦不能燒
translation: a weapon cannot harm, nor can a fire burn it

source_sentence: 至於眠睡中　　常不見惡夢
translation: As for sleeping, I never see bad dreams.

source_sentence: 若為王繫縛　　及在賊手中
translation: if he is bound by the king and in the hands of a thief

source_sentence: 或山崖巇嶮　　乃至於江河
translation: There are mountain cliffs and mountain peaks, even rivers.

source_sentence: 一切恐怖難　　悉皆得解脫
translation: all terrifying difficulties are fully liberated

source_sentence: 眾罪及苦惱　　解脫而安隱
translation: liberated and at ease from numerous sins and afflictions

source_sentence: 明力及慧力　　而為大威德
translation: the power of insight and the power of wisdom, which are great in their authority

source_sentence: 凡所作事業　　能速得成就
translation: all undertakings are quickly accomplished
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)素[口*(隸-木+士)](引二)素素[口*(隸-木+士)](引三)嚩囉(四)嚩嚩囉(五)摩曩婆嚩(引六)娑摩囉(引七)護隷(引八)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引九)摩隷(引十)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十一)佛言我先求菩提時。
translation: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)素[口*(隸-木+士)](引二)素素[口*(隸-木+士)](引三)嚩囉(四)嚩嚩囉(五)摩曩婆嚩(引六)娑摩囉(引七)護隷(引八)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引九)摩隷(引十)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十一)佛言我先求菩提時。
When I was a six-tusked white elephant.
I was a shield for that hunter.
If this is true, I wish for all sentient beings.
All suffering and distress will be removed.

source_sentence: 我於過去之世為海中龜時。
translation: When I was a turtle in the ocean in a past life, my body was cut off and my mind was not hateful.
My body was cut off, and my mind wasn't hateful.
If this is true, I wish for all sentient beings.
All illnesses would be completely eliminated.'
He then said this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)呬隷弭隸儞(二)度嚕(二合)鑁跛能(去四)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)佛言我過去世求菩提時。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他(引一)呬隷弭隸訪問(二)杜嚕(二合)豺跛能(去四)娑婆(二合引)賀(引五)The Buddha said, 'When I sought enlightenment in a past life, I gave various kinds of happiness to sentient beings.
I gave various kinds of comfort to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我昔為雉被獵師所獲所要施與。
translation: In the past, I was a hunter of pheasants and wanted to give something to them.
I arouse a compassionate mind and observed that no hatred would arise.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞野(二合)他(引一)鼻哩(二)度度度儞(三)摩賀(引)曩諦(引四)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)度度度儞(引六)呬致弭致(七)鼻致哩(八)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引九)佛言我為忍辱仙人時。
translation: "Taninuo (二合)他(引用一)无里(二)杜度度访谈(三)多多度访谈(引)摩賀(引用)曩諦(引)四)娑婆(二合引)賀(引5)娑婆(二合引)杜度度祝贺(引5)杜度度度訪問(引6)瘘致弭致(七)鼻致里(八)娑婆(二合引)賀(引9)佛说我為忍辱仙人時。
I cultivated the perfection of forbearance in contemplation.
My mind isn't disturbed.

source_sentence: 觀察一切有情由如赤子。
translation: I observed that all sentient beings are nothing but red sons.
I bleed from my body and turn it into milk.
When I gave all that I had to give in order to pursue bodhi.
That brāhmaṇa came to me.

source_sentence: 而乞其頭以頭施之乃以髮索繫縛於樹。
translation: He begged for his head and gave it to me with his head. Then, he tied a cord of hair to a tree.

source_sentence: 我於是時起慈悲心不生嗔恨。
translation: At the time, I aroused compassion and didn't become angry.
I observed that the brāhmaṇa was like a red child.

source_sentence: 乃至妻妾皆悉施與我不求五慾樂不求王自在不求天富貴。
translation: They all gave me their wives and concubines, not seeking the five desires and pleasures, not seeking the king's sovereignty, and not seeking the gods' wealth and riches.

source_sentence: 真實為彼降伏魔羅及以眷屬。
translation: He truly subdues Māra and his retinue for them.

source_sentence: 乃至調伏一切冤家得最上位。
translation: They'll even subdue all their enemies and attain the highest position.
In order to disparage them, I explain the great power of luminosity.

source_sentence: 而能出生過去行菩提行。
translation: It's capable of giving rise to the past practice of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 為降伏魔羅我今復說即說呪曰。
translation: Now, I'll explain this spell for the purpose of subduing Māra, saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(去聲引一)企企[寧*頁](二)尾麼那[寧*頁](三)尾度度度寧(上四)麼賀(引)曩底(丁曳反)囉拏(二合)嚩底(五)麼賀(引)嚩(引)囉他(二合)嚩底(六)醯醯醯(七)弭弭禮(八)始始抳(九)始抳始抳(十)悉哩抳(十一)弭哩抳(十二)麼賀(引)弭哩抳(十三)禮禮[寧*頁](十四)弭里抳(十五)抳娑嚩(二合)羅跛(二合)嚩(引)儞[寧*頁](十六)底底[寧*頁](十七)蜜底哩抳(十八)薩(轉舌)嚩迦(引)麼(引)囉他(二合)娑(引上)達[寧*頁](十九)設咄嚕(二合)達哩灑(二合)抳(二十)設嚩達[口*(隸-木+士)](二十一)麼賀(引)達[口*(隸-木+士)](二十二)儞(泥翳反)跛多(二合)達[口*(隸-木+士)](二十三)乞芻(二合)嚕(引上)跛謎(二十四)娑賀娑囉(二合)馱(引)[口*(隸-木+士)](二十五)尾麼禮(二十六)烏仡囉(二合)底(丁曳反)乞瑟膩(三合二十七)麼賀哆閉(二十八)設咄嚕(二合)[哧*皮](引)佩孕迦(引)哩(二十九)布爾(仁除反)哆(上)底哩(二合)數路(去引)計數(三十)儞(泥逸反)底焰(二合)路(去引)計數尾戍嚕(二合)哆(上引三十一)悉馱(引)佐底哩(二合)數(三十三)路(去引)計瑟嚩(二合)[寧*頁](泥逸反)爾哆(上三十四)沒囉(二合)憾麼(二合)難拏數(二合)跛謎(三十五)悉弟設訖底(二合三十六)塞建(二合)馱寫也(二合)尾戍嚕(二合)帝(三十七)我為汝說。
translation: 怛儞也(二合)他(去聲引一)企企[寧*頁](二)尾麼那[寧*頁](三)尾度度度寧(上四)麼賀(引)曩底(丁曳反)囉拏(二合)嚩底(五)麼賀(引)嚩(引)囉他(二合)嚩底(六)醯醯醯(七)弭弭禮(八)始始抳(九)始抳始抳(十)悉哩抳(十一)弭哩抳(十二)麼賀(引)弭哩抳(十三)禮禮[寧*頁](十四)弭里抳(十五)抳娑嚩(二合)羅跛(二合)嚩(引)儞[寧*頁](十六)底底[寧*頁](十七)蜜底哩抳(十八)薩(轉舌)嚩迦(引)麼(引)囉他(二合)娑(引上)達[寧*頁](十九)設咄嚕(二合)達哩灑(二合)抳(二十)設嚩達[口*(隸-木+士)](二十一)麼賀(引)達[口*(隸-木+士)](二十二)儞(泥翳反)跛多(二合)達[口*(隸-木+士)](二十三)乞芻(二合)嚕(引上)跛謎(二十四)娑賀娑囉(二合)馱(引)[口*(隸-木+士)](二十五)尾麼禮(二十六)烏仡囉(二合)底(丁曳反)乞瑟膩(三合二十七)麼賀哆閉(二十八)設咄嚕(二合)[哧*皮](引)佩孕迦(引)哩(二十九)布爾(仁除反)哆(上)底哩(二合)數路(去引)計數(三十)儞(泥逸反)底焰(二合)路(去引)計數尾戍嚕(二合)哆(上引三十一)悉馱(引)佐底哩(二合)數(三十三)路(去引)計瑟嚩(二合)[寧*頁](泥逸反)爾哆(上三十四)沒囉(二合)憾麼(二合)難拏數(二合)跛謎(三十五)悉弟設訖底(二合三十六)塞建(二合)馱寫也(二合)尾戍嚕(二合)帝(三十七)我為汝說。
'That great luminous power is marked by authoritative exertion.'

source_sentence: 天與阿蘇羅兩陣相持時。
translation: When the gods and Asura were locked in battle, they remembered that there's nothing here that can overcome him.

source_sentence: 天憶念此無能勝彼自降伏。
translation: The gods remembered that they were invincible and subdued themselves.

source_sentence: 汝天精進與一切阿蘇羅。
translation: Your gods' zeal and the zeal of all the asuras.
They support each other for a thousand years of your god's life.
He investigates their skillful means and sees that they're unable to overcome them.
If there's no surpassing true strength, then he'll be able to accomplish it.
You'll be reborn in the Brahma Heaven.

source_sentence: 如是恒常作種種事業而無能勝彼梵天威德。
translation: Thus, you'll always perform various tasks, but there's nothing that can surpass the authority of that Brahma god.
Because they make offerings, the buddhas tell them.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 為於世間作最上修行圓滿。
translation: "In order to achieve the highest level of cultivation in the world, I'll complete it.
I accomplished the work of the Buddha and attained enlightenment.
I subdued the army of Māra and turned the wheel of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 復有千俱胝淨居天眾來。
translation: Again, there were a thousand koṭīs from the Pure Land gods who came.
They arouse a profound thought in front of me.
With a gentle voice, they asked him to turn the wheel of the Dharma.
The Buddha addressed Śāriputra and said.
"Listen closely, Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 此無能勝明王利益安樂一切有情。
translation: 'This is the peerless luminous king who benefits and pleases all sentient beings.'
In a past life, Śāriputra was fighting with Asura.
The gods and asuras fought each other.

source_sentence: 是時天眾退散阿蘇羅得勝。
translation: The multitude of gods then retreated, and Asura prevailed.
It was then that the god Tishri Devaputra was victorious.
He then took this unsurpassed dhāraṇī.
He wrote it on a gold leaf and placed it on the head of his flag.
They then fought each other again.
The multitude of gods was then victorious.
Asura's army then retreated.
He then spoke the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 怛(上)儞也(二合)他(去引一)沒素謎(二)嚩素迦囉帝(三)曩(引)虞(上)那哩佐(四)迦播哩抳(五)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引六)佛告舍利子。
translation: "Tā (supra) niyaya (dichotomy) tat (deprecatory case) (1) musu (2) vasu karate (3) an (citation needed) yu (supra) nārizo (4) kaparīja (5) svāh (dichotomy) (citation needed) (6) The Buddha told Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 我不見有諸天及魔羅等。
translation: "I don't see any gods, māras, or the like.
...even human ascetics and priests.
Asura, all demons, and so forth.
Āpaśamālā, the gandharvas, and the gandharvas.

source_sentence: 藥叉囉乞叉蘖路荼緊那羅。
translation: He's a hermit, a robber, a tiller, a kiṃnara, or a neuter.

source_sentence: 尾那夜迦布旦曩供盤拏。
translation: Vinaya Kappadānāga makes offerings to Pannaea.
"Kāṭaputta-nāma eats those who are born, and so forth.

source_sentence: 於此無能勝大明王無敢違犯。
translation: Nothing here is superior to the great luminous king, and he dares not transgress.
Thus is the dhāraṇī of the great luminous king.
If someone doesn't see or hear it, then they won't dare to transgress it.

source_sentence: 乃是過去見在業所障故。
translation: It's because they've been hindered by past views and present karma.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說是陀羅尼一切成就已。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān explained this dhāraṇī and everything was accomplished.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀舍利子天人阿蘇羅等。
translation: Ānanda, Śāriputra, the gods, Asura, and others then wholeheartedly accepted it, rejoiced, and handed it down.
They wholeheartedly accepted it, rejoiced, and handed it down.

source_sentence: 佛說無能勝大明王陀羅尼經
translation: The Buddha Explained the Dhāraṇī of the Invincible Great King of Illumination
